intro: Ptilotrichum dahuricum, commonly known as the Siberian bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the cold climates of Siberia and northern Asia. It features a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue to purple, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy choice for rocky or alpine gardens. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts of cold-climate gardening.
